title.narrative: Inclusive Development Programme In Northern Kosovo/Support To Municipality Of Vushtrri

description.narrative: This programme was initiated in directresponse to a joint request to UN-Habitat by the Ministry of Environment and Spatial Planning (MESP) and the Ministry of Local Government Administration (MLGA) to extend ad hoc planning and governance mechanismsin the north of Kosovo with a focus on building the capacity of municipal institutions and staff, guiding rational investments based on strategic development planning, and ultimately improving living conditions for citizens.The request came in recognition of UN-Habitat's expertise in the field of spatial and urban planning, and its long engagement as a trusted international partner in municipal institution and capacity building in Kosovo, related established support mechanisms (including in non-majority municipalities and within relevant ministries) as well as the initial and promising results of engagement with northern municipalities. UN-Habitat also received a joint request for capacity development support from the mayors of the four northern Serb-majority municipalities. UN-Habitat joined with PAX to broaden the scope of the proposed support package, with activities that would complement technical interventions around municipal planning and governance with efforts to strengthen the social contract between state and citizen andestablish trust between all levels of government.The Municipality of Vushtrri requested additional substantive technical assistance from UN-Habitat while offering the required co-financing (subject of the present sub-project).The programme responds to acute needs for support identified in the report north Kosovo in 2020, based on extensive consultation with communities and civil society in the northern municipalities, as well as by newly established local administrations following the local elections in November 2013. The programme is aligned and supports the realisation of the 2016-21 National Development Strategy (in which inclusive development is a sub-theme) and the 2015-2020 Strategy for Modernization of Public Administration (which includes transparent and responsible public administration with a clear accountability system as well as continuous information of citizens on development and delivery of public services, on their rights and how they can be realized).Finally, the programme is directly linked to national and global agendas and contributes (but is not limited) to the Post-2015 Agenda to Goal 11 – Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable, with target 11.3 – By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries; as well as to Goal 16 – Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels, with target 16.6 – Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels, and target 16.7 – Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Increased compliance and quality of the governance practices of Municipality of Vushtrri achieved through development of institutional capacities to progressively improve performance of their responsibilities related to integrated spatial and urban planning and development, consistent with Kosovo’s planning system and principles of sound public administration

description.narrative: Increased compliance and quality of the governance practices of Municipality of Vushtrri achieved through development of institutional capacities to progressively improve performance of their responsibilities related to integrated spatial and urban planning and development, consistent with Kosovo’s planning system and principles of sound public administration

title.narrative:
1.M. of Vushtrri with institutional capacities to conduct planning processes
2.No. and performance of municipal planning structures, mechanism set-up for municipal, urban planning and effective service delivery
3.No. participatory tools, mechanisms implemented and institutionalized that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive planning processes
4. The MZM (including evaluation of MDP and local spatial planning database) developed by municipal staff
5. The SEA developed by municipal staff towards environment protection/ restoration and climate change mitigation

description.narrative:
1.M. of Vushtrri with institutional capacities to conduct planning processes
2.No. and performance of municipal planning structures, mechanism set-up for municipal, urban planning and effective service delivery
3.No. participatory tools, mechanisms implemented and institutionalized that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive planning processes
4. The MZM (including evaluation of MDP and local spatial planning database) developed by municipal staff
5. The SEA developed by municipal staff towards environment protection/ restoration and climate change mitigation

baseline.value:
1.Weak municipal capacities to conduct, implement and monitor spatial, urban planning processes;
2.No municipal mechanisms/ structures set-up for spatial planning and effective service delivery; poor performance of municipal planning structures into planning processes
3.Few standing mechanisms to support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive planning processes; no tradition of practicing participatory approaches for decisions affecting regional and local development and constituencies
4.No MZM (including local spatial planning database) developed by municipal staff in operational support of sustainable development
5.No SEAs developed by municipal staff; poor quality of previous SEA for MDP developed by consulting company, no involvement of citizens/CSOs in drafting processes, poor integration of SEA findings into planning documents and decision-making processes

target.value:
1. In 2019, approximately 40 municipal officials (7-11 officials (including director) from the Department of Urbanism and Environment Protection; 15 members of the Municipal Planning Team/Steering Committee, 7-10 members of the WG for establishment of the spatial planning database, 7 interns, and 1-2 official from the information office) Annual increase in no. and performance of local municipal staff engaged in planning processes (/ benefiting from daily on-the job assistance and advisory services/ trained on respective planning training modules;
2. In 2019, four (4) main planning structures (steering committee, municipal planning team and working group for spatial planning database), around 35-40 meetings were held and all office/field data for 65 settlements (Vushtrri) were collected, processed and migrated into spatial planning database (local level). In 2020, four (4) main planning structures are still operational, additional seven (7) sub-working thematic groups are established/ functionalized and engaged in zoning activities for the whole municipality of Vushtrri (65 settlements). In addition, approximately 35-50 meetings were held regarding zoning and drafting of MZM activities.Municipality of Vushtrri meets 5 criteria.
3. In 2019, five (5) various Annual increase no. participatory tools and, mechanisms ( regular weekly/monthly coordination meetings with municipal staff and interns; information/consultation sessions and public debates with citizens, interest groups, civil society organizations, businesses, public companies, village representatives, women, inter-municipal cooperation meetings etc) implemented and institutionalized that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive planning processes. Approximately 35-40 meetings were held, and around 150 citizens (various groups, male/female etc) were informed/consulted for MZM process. In 2020, the number of consulted/heard citizens/CSOs/Businesses increased in 500.
4.MZMs (including sIn 2019, the spatial planning database (local level)) developed with inclusive and participatory approach. In 2020, MZM were drafted and approved by respective authorities (local/central level).
5. In 2019, the working group for SEA was established and operationalized. Regular working meeting are held on this regard, and consultation meeting with citizens, CSOs and other interest groups are organized. In 2020, the SEA developed in-house with inclusive and participatory tools used in drafting processes in support of environment protection/ restoration and climate change mitigation; increased no. of citizens/CSOs in drafting processes; no of environmental protective and climate change mitigation measures developed.
